arm_group.description: Participants in this group will have their medication refill schedule synchronized.
Participants in this arm will receive usual care

brief_summary.textblock:
To determine the effect of synchronizing a patient's prescription refill schedule on
      medication adherence. The targeted population is Humana members who are currently taking 2
      or more Stars medications (hypertension, hypercholesterolemia, diabetes) and are current
      customers of RightSource. Participants will be randomized to one of two groups. Group one
      will be usual care and group two will be the Rx synchronization group.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Effect of Synching Prescription Refills on Adherence

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Humana members who are currently taking 2 or more Stars medications (hypertension,
             hypercholesterolemia, diabetes) and are current customers of RightSource.

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  under 18 years of age

clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized Controlled Trial to Test a Synchronized Prescription Refill Program to Improve Medication Adherence

primary_outcome.measure: Medication adherence to each of the chronic medications as measured by the proportion of days covered (PDC) measure

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.measure: Secondary outcomes will be continuous gaps (e.g. 15, 30, or 60 days) in medication use.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Prevention
